trans-unit.source: Feature Selection
trans-unit.target: Feature Selection

trans-unit.source: Feature Selection Modules
trans-unit.target: Feature Selection Modules

trans-unit.source: Overview of Feature Selection
trans-unit.target: Overview of Feature Selection

trans-unit.source: In machine learning and statistics, <newTerm>feature selection</newTerm> is the process of selecting a subset of relevant, useful features for use in building an analytical model.
trans-unit.target: In machine learning and statistics, <newTerm>feature selection</newTerm> is the process of selecting a subset of relevant, useful features for use in building an analytical model.

trans-unit.source: Feature selection helps narrow the field of data to just the most valuable inputs, reducing noise and improving training performance.
trans-unit.target: Feature selection helps narrow the field of data to just the most valuable inputs, reducing noise and improving training performance.

trans-unit.source: Often features are created from the raw data through a process of feature engineering.
trans-unit.target: Often features are created from the raw data through a process of feature engineering.

trans-unit.source: For example, a time stamp in itself might not be useful for modelling until transformed into units of days, months, or categories relevant to the problem such as holiday vs. working day, etc.
trans-unit.target: For example, a time stamp in itself might not be useful for modelling until transformed into units of days, months, or categories relevant to the problem such as holiday vs. working day, etc.

trans-unit.source: New users of machine learning are often tempted to add in all data that is available, expecting the algorithm will find something interesting.
trans-unit.target: New users of machine learning are often tempted to add in all data that is available, expecting the algorithm will find something interesting.

trans-unit.source: However, feature selection can improve your model and prevent problems.
trans-unit.target: However, feature selection can improve your model and prevent problems.

trans-unit.source: The data might contain redundant or irrelevant features, which provide no more information than the currently selected features.
trans-unit.target: The data might contain redundant or irrelevant features, which provide no more information than the currently selected features.

trans-unit.source: The data might also contain irrelevant features that provide no useful information in any context.
trans-unit.target: The data might also contain irrelevant features that provide no useful information in any context.

trans-unit.source: Including irrelevant fields not only increases the time for training the data, but also can lead to poor results.
trans-unit.target: Including irrelevant fields not only increases the time for training the data, but also can lead to poor results.

trans-unit.source: With some algorithms, having duplicate information in the training data can lead to a phenomenon called multicollinearity, in which the presence of two highly correlated variables can cause the calculations for other variables to become much less accurate.
trans-unit.target: With some algorithms, having duplicate information in the training data can lead to a phenomenon called multicollinearity, in which the presence of two highly correlated variables can cause the calculations for other variables to become much less accurate.

trans-unit.source: <token>ProductName</token> provides multiple feature selection methods so that you can work with all data types.
trans-unit.target: <token>ProductName</token> provides multiple feature selection methods so that you can work with all data types.

trans-unit.source: Additionally, some machine learning algorithms use some kind of feature selection or dimensionality reduction as part of the learning process.
trans-unit.target: Additionally, some machine learning algorithms use some kind of feature selection or dimensionality reduction as part of the learning process.

trans-unit.source: When you use these learners, you can skip the feature selection process and let the algorithm decide the best inputs.
trans-unit.target: When you use these learners, you can skip the feature selection process and let the algorithm decide the best inputs.

trans-unit.source: These options are summarized here to help you choose the method most suited to your problem and to your data.
trans-unit.target: These options are summarized here to help you choose the method most suited to your problem and to your data.

trans-unit.source: Feature Selection Modules in Azure Machine Learning
trans-unit.target: Feature Selection Modules in Azure Machine Learning

trans-unit.source: The feature selection modules in Azure Machine Learning Studio apply well-known statistical methods to the data columns provided as input, creating metrics that you can use to identify the columns that have the best information value.
trans-unit.target: The feature selection modules in Azure Machine Learning Studio apply well-known statistical methods to the data columns provided as input, creating metrics that you can use to identify the columns that have the best information value.

trans-unit.source: Linear Discriminant Analysis
trans-unit.target: Linear Discriminant Analysis

trans-unit.source: Linear Discriminant Analysis is a supervised learning technique that can be used for classifying numerical variables in conjunction with a single categorical target.
trans-unit.target: Linear Discriminant Analysis is a supervised learning technique that can be used for classifying numerical variables in conjunction with a single categorical target.

trans-unit.source: The method is useful for feature selection because it identifies the combination of features or parameters that best separates the groups.
trans-unit.target: The method is useful for feature selection because it identifies the combination of features or parameters that best separates the groups.

trans-unit.source: You can use the module just to generate a set of scores for review, or you can use the replacement dataset generated by the module for training.
trans-unit.target: You can use the module just to generate a set of scores for review, or you can use the replacement dataset generated by the module for training.

trans-unit.source: Filter-Based Feature Selection
trans-unit.target: Filter-Based Feature Selection

trans-unit.source: This module lets you choose from among well-known feature selection methods, and outputs both the feature selection statistics, and the filtered dataset.
trans-unit.target: This module lets you choose from among well-known feature selection methods, and outputs both the feature selection statistics, and the filtered dataset.

trans-unit.source: Your choice of a filter selection method depends in part on what sort of input data you have.
trans-unit.target: Your choice of a filter selection method depends in part on what sort of input data you have.

trans-unit.source: Principal Component Analysis
trans-unit.target: Principal Component Analysis

trans-unit.source: When you have a dataset with many columns, you can use the <link xlink:href="8be18eb5-ddd8-4d12-8573-7ae10d5f72fb" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Principal Component Analysis</link> module to detect the columns that are the most useful; that is, the columns that contain the most information (variation) about the original data.
trans-unit.target: When you have a dataset with many columns, you can use the <link xlink:href="8be18eb5-ddd8-4d12-8573-7ae10d5f72fb" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Principal Component Analysis</link> module to detect the columns that are the most useful; that is, the columns that contain the most information (variation) about the original data.

trans-unit.source: All feature selection modules and analytical methods that support numeric and logical columns support date-time and time span columns as well.
trans-unit.target: All feature selection modules and analytical methods that support numeric and logical columns support date-time and time span columns as well.

trans-unit.source: These columns are treated as simple numeric columns where each value equals to the number of ticks.
trans-unit.target: These columns are treated as simple numeric columns where each value equals to the number of ticks.

trans-unit.source: Machine Learning Methods that Use Feature Selection
trans-unit.target: Machine Learning Methods that Use Feature Selection

trans-unit.source: Some learners in Azure Machine Learning Studio also provide parameters that can be used to optimize feature selection when training.
trans-unit.target: Some learners in Azure Machine Learning Studio also provide parameters that can be used to optimize feature selection when training.

trans-unit.source: If you are using a method that has its own heuristic for choosing features, it is often better to rely on that heuristic rather than pre-selecting features.
trans-unit.target: If you are using a method that has its own heuristic for choosing features, it is often better to rely on that heuristic rather than pre-selecting features.

trans-unit.source: Boosted Decision Tree Classification Models and Boosted Decision Tree Regression Models
trans-unit.target: Boosted Decision Tree Classification Models and Boosted Decision Tree Regression Models

trans-unit.source: In these modules, internally a feature summary is created and features with weight 0 are not used by any tree splits.
trans-unit.target: In these modules, internally a feature summary is created and features with weight 0 are not used by any tree splits.

trans-unit.source: When you review the results of the model, make a note of these unused columns as they are likely candidates for removal.
trans-unit.target: When you review the results of the model, make a note of these unused columns as they are likely candidates for removal.

trans-unit.source: Parameter sweeping is recommended to optimize selection.
trans-unit.target: Parameter sweeping is recommended to optimize selection.

trans-unit.source: Logistic Regression Models
trans-unit.target: Logistic Regression Models

trans-unit.source: The modules for multiclass and binary logistic regression support L1 and L# regularization.
trans-unit.target: The modules for multiclass and binary logistic regression support L1 and L# regularization.

trans-unit.source: <legacyItalic>Regularization</legacyItalic> is a way of adding constraints when training to manually specify some aspect of the learned model.
trans-unit.target: <legacyItalic>Regularization</legacyItalic> is a way of adding constraints when training to manually specify some aspect of the learned model.

trans-unit.source: Regularization is generally used to avoid overfitting.
trans-unit.target: Regularization is generally used to avoid overfitting.

trans-unit.source: <token>ProductName</token> supports regularization for the L1 or L2 norms of the weight vector in linear classification algorithms.
trans-unit.target: <token>ProductName</token> supports regularization for the L1 or L2 norms of the weight vector in linear classification algorithms.

trans-unit.source: L1 regularization is useful if the goal is to have a model that is as sparse as possible.
trans-unit.target: L1 regularization is useful if the goal is to have a model that is as sparse as possible.

trans-unit.source: L2 regularization prevents any single coordinate in the weight vector from growing too much in magnitude, so it is useful if the goal is to have a model with small overall weights.
trans-unit.target: L2 regularization prevents any single coordinate in the weight vector from growing too much in magnitude, so it is useful if the goal is to have a model with small overall weights.

trans-unit.source: L1-regularized logistic regression is more aggressive about assigning a weight of 0 to features, and therefore useful in identifying features that can be removed.
trans-unit.target: L1-regularized logistic regression is more aggressive about assigning a weight of 0 to features, and therefore useful in identifying features that can be removed.

trans-unit.source: List of Modules
trans-unit.target: List of Modules

trans-unit.source: The category Modules References.Feature Selection includes these modules:
trans-unit.target: The category Modules References.Feature Selection includes these modules:

trans-unit.source: Module
trans-unit.target: Module

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Identifies the features in a dataset with the greatest predictive power
trans-unit.target: Identifies the features in a dataset with the greatest predictive power

trans-unit.source: Identifies the linear combination of feature variables that can best group data into separate classes
trans-unit.target: Identifies the linear combination of feature variables that can best group data into separate classes

trans-unit.source: Computes the permutation feature importance scores of feature variables given a trained model and a test dataset
trans-unit.target: Computes the permutation feature importance scores of feature variables given a trained model and a test dataset
